description.narrative: The project impact goal is defined as "rebuilt ties and improved confidence between Mostar communities, a decrease of tensions and no more negative stereotyping in Mostar region and throughout BiH. The outcome level goal is to serve as a platform with the range of services for young people promoting MoRS as an example of functional interethnic collaboration

Mostar Rock School (MoRS) bildades 2012 och registrerades som en lokal NGO 2014. Skolan har tre anställda samt flera musiklärare och tekniker anställda på deltid. Deras huvudsakliga verksamhet är att ansluta ungdomar i det uppdelade samhället som Mostar består av genom musikutbildning och genom en plattform som ger stöd till unga musiker och band i Mostar och i en vidare region. MoRS är fortfarande relativt ny i organisationsutveckling och stor del av deras verksamhet är finansierat av givare. Norska ambassaden har gett stöd sedan starten med 500 000 NOK. Den andra fasen kommer att separat stödjas av Sverige och USAID. Även andra givare är intresserade (Schweiz, Norge).

The stated goal of the project is to (re)building ties and inter ethnic confidence among Mostar communities. The MoRS is best described as a social change maker. The target group is youth who have grown up in a divided post conflict environment. The project is relevant from 2 aspects of the Swedish strategy: prevention of discrimination, and reconciliation/conflict reduction. This is precisely defined under result 13 of the current strategy, promoting trust and reconciliation.
MoRS is requesting support for core activities of the school for a period of 34 months, starting March 2017. The budget is reasonable and risks are appraised to be acceptable.

tag.narrative: 16.a - Strengthen relevant national institutions, including through international cooperation, for building capacity at all levels, in particular in developing countries, to prevent violence and combat terrorism and crime.

16.a - Stärka berörda nationella institutioner, bland annat genom internationellt samarbete, i syfte att bygga upp kapacitet på alla nivåer, i synnerhet i utvecklingsländerna, för att förebygga våld och bekämpa terrorism och brottslighet.

description.narrative: MoRS is a unique feature in BiH both in terms of it focus on youth (but also and not to forget to the parents and the older generation of these youngsters) but also on its ambitions to build (re-) ties between different ethnic groups in BiH and in particular in the divided town of Mostar in Central BiH. They serve as a platform with a range of services, linked to musical development and where young people are able to explore their interest and potential in music (arts). Large number of students have been enrolled during the years and in 2018/2019 162 students entered compared to 140 in the school year 2019/2020. Students were from mixed ethnic backgrounds and of both sexes/gender. Apart from Pavarotti centre and the regular school in operation they have also had another 30 plus students taking part in the Mobile Rock School in four (4) cities of BiH. In the latest year five program concerts were organised reaching over 300 people per concert from both sides of Mostar. In total over 4800 hours of lessons during the last 12 months period were held in MoRS classrooms, and then an additional 1000 hours of individual and band rehearsals. Indicators of success worth mentioning is a total of 75 mixed bands formed throughout four session band cycles with 12 months period. The mobile rock school has been operational in the following four places in BiH; Siroki Brijeg, Caplinja, Livno and Posusje. MoRS has been recognized in local, regional and international world media. MoRS if also recognized by local institutions and organisations and invited to play at various cultural and humanitarian events. The booking department of MoRS has organised 137 shows during 2019, of which 11 were outside of BiH (Serbia, Croatia, Slovenia and in Norway).
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
